subject: java.beans.XMLEncoder with swing GUI JUnit
msgSnippet: Hi All! I have a problem with java.beans.XMLEncoder that only occures when my test is run in the swing GUI JUnit and not when I run through ant. My XMLEncoder
messageBody:
Hi All!

I have a problem with java.beans.XMLEncoder that only occures when my test
is run in the swing GUI JUnit and not when I run through ant.

My XMLEncoder test runs fine when I run it via ant. But when I run it using
the swing gui (running from within idea) it comes up with the stack overflow
error below. Normally my tests run fine in both ways.

Details below. Any ideas?

Thanks in advance.

Morten

The error i get running via JUnit swing version (via idea):

java.lang.StackOverflowError
at java.lang.Class.getMethod0(Class.java:1756)
at java.lang.Class.getMethod(Class.java:963)
at java.beans.Statement.findPublicMethod(Statement.java:230)
at java.beans.Statement.findMethod(Statement.java:270)
at java.beans.Statement.getMethod(Statement.java:366)
at java.beans.Statement.invoke(Statement.java:439)
at java.beans.Expression.getValue(Expression.java:101)

java.beans.PersistenceDelegate.writeObject(PersistenceDelegate.java:100)

at java.beans.XMLEncoder.writeObject(XMLEncoder.java:250)

My test looks like this:

import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;

import java.io.*;

public class XMLEncoderTest extends TestCase {

public XMLEncoderTest(String name) {
super(name);
}

protected void setUp() {
}

protected void tearDown() {
}

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(XMLEncoderTest.class);
}

public void testSpiking() {
try {
MyClass myObject = new MyClass();
myObject.setName("Max");
myObject.setValue(0.001);

String xmlFileName = System.getProperty("user.dir")+
"/"+"Sample.xml";
WOXMLEncoder encoder = new WOXMLEncoder(
new BufferedOutputStream(
new FileOutputStream(xmlFileName)));
encoder.writeObject(myObject);
encoder.close();

WOXMLDecoder decoder = new WOXMLDecoder(
new BufferedInputStream(
new FileInputStream(xmlFileName)));
MyClass myReadObject = (MyClass)decoder.readObject();
decoder.close();

assertEquals("Name", "Max", myReadObject.getName());
assertEquals("Name", 0.001, myReadObject.getValue(), 0.0);
} catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
fail("FileNotFoundException should not be thrown here.\n"+e);
}
}
}

Where my test class looks like:

public class MyClass {
private String name;
private double value;

public String getName(){
return ""+name;
}

public void setName(String name){
this.name = ""+name;
}

public double getValue(){
return value;
}

public void setValue(double value){
this.value = value;
}
}
